page.title: 13EMPLOYMENT SURVEY, DUNMURRY
page.content: We took a sample survey of where the people in Dunmurry worked and we discovered that 49% of the sample travelled to Belfast which is 8 km away. Most of this 49% was male and the jobs varied from industrial to professional. We then found that 42% of the sample worked in the village. These were mainly female and their work was in the retail trade and in the care of the elderly. 9% of the sample travelled to other towns for work. These were males working in small industry. It seems that Dunmurry is an area of shops employing mostly women but because of good communications with Belfast it is a good commuter area for men working in the city.
